The former president of [[FC Barcelona]], [[Josep Lluís Núñez]], the current vicepresident, Carles Vilarrubí, and Eduardo Fernando de Blas, the vicepresident of [[Real Madrid]], had offshore companies with Mossack Fonseca.<ref>{{cite web |title=Josep Lluís Núñez, expresident del FC Barcelona, també apareix en els "papers de Panamà" |url=http://www.ccma.cat/esport3/josep-lluis-nunez-expresident-del-fc-barcelona-tambe-apareix-en-els-papers-de-panama/noticia/2725029/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160424181642/http://www.ccma.cat/esport3/josep-lluis-nunez-expresident-del-fc-barcelona-tambe-apareix-en-els-papers-de-panama/noticia/2725029/ |archivedate=April 24, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Carles Vilarrubí justifica la seva aparició en els 'Papers de Panamà' |url=http://www.catalunyapress.cat/texto-diario/mostrar/427566/carles-vilarrubi-justifica-la-seva-aparicio-en-els-papers-de-panam |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422055146/http://www.catalunyapress.cat/texto-diario/mostrar/427566/carles-vilarrubi-justifica-la-seva-aparicio-en-els-papers-de-panam |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=La mano derecha de Florentino Pérez, en los 'Papeles de Panamá' |url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/deportes/futbol/20160422/401286645984/eduardo-fernandez-de-blas-real-madrid-florentino-perez-papeles-de-panama.html}}</ref>
==== Sweden ==== The Swedish [[Financial Supervisory Authority (Sweden)|Financial Supervisory Authority]] (FI) said on April 4, 2016, it would investigate the actions of [[Nordea]], one of the largest financial institutions in the Nordic countries, after the Panama Papers revealed the bank's Luxembourg office had helped to set up nearly 400 offshore companies for its clients between 2004 and 2014 in Panama and the [[British Virgin Islands]] for their customers.<ref name="mordea">{{cite web|url=http://svenska.yle.fi/artikel/2016/04/03/nordea-grundade-hundratals-skatteparadisbolag-kunder|title=Nordea grundade hundratals skatteparadisbolag åt kunder {{!}} Svenska Yle|trans-title=Nordea founded hundreds of tax haven companies on behalf of customers|date=April 4, 2016|language=Swedish|author=Kjell Lindroos|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160403183024/http://svenska.yle.fi/artikel/2016/04/03/nordea-grundade-hundratals-skatteparadisbolag-kunder|archivedate=April 3, 2016|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name=yle-nordea>{{cite web |title=Monday's papers |url=http://yle.fi/uutiset/mondays_papers_panama_papers_local_finns_party_vice_chair_sacked_world_champ_dreams_knocked_out/8785280 |publisher=[[YLE]] |accessdate=April 4, 2016 |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024658/http://yle.fi/uutiset/mondays_papers_panama_papers_local_finns_party_vice_chair_sacked_world_champ_dreams_knocked_out/8785280 |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (FI) has said that "serious deficiencies" exist in how Nordea monitors for [[money laundering]], and had given the bank two warnings. In 2015 Nordea had to pay the largest possible fine—over five million EUR.<ref name="mordea" /> In 2012 Nordea asked [[Mossack Fonseca]] to change documents retroactively so that three Danish customers' power of attorney documents would appear to have been in force since 2010.<ref name="mordea" /> The director for Nordea Private Banking, Thorben Sanders, has admitted that before 2009 Nordea did not screen for tax evaders: "In the end of 2009 we decided that our bank shall not be a means of [[tax evasion]]," said Sanders.<!--"I slutet av 2009 beslöt vi att vår bank inte längre ska kunna användas för att kringgå skatt."--><ref name="mordea" /> Other Swedish banks are also present in the documents, but Nordea occurs 10,902 times and the next most frequently mentioned bank only occurs 764 times.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.svd.se/detta-behover-du-veta-om-panama-lackan#sida-3 |title=svd Detta behöver du veta om Panamaläckan |date=April 4, 2016 |language=Swedish |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024908/http://www.svd.se/detta-behover-du-veta-om-panama-lackan#sida-3 |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (FI) later said that they would also investigate the other three big banks in Sweden: [[Handelsbanken]], [[Skandinaviska Enskilda Banken]] (SEB) and [[Swedbank]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2016}}
Nordea cut all ties with Mossack Fonseca following an interview with Nordea CEO [[Casper von Koskull]] on [[Sveriges Television|SVT]] on April 4.<ref name=yle-nordea /><ref name=local-nordea>{{cite web |title=Nordea bank investigated over tax haven scandal |url=http://www.thelocal.se/20160404/swedens-nordea-bank-in-global-tax-tangle |publisher=The Local (Sweden) |accessdate=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405155247/http://www.thelocal.se/20160404/swedens-nordea-bank-in-global-tax-tangle |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.svt.se/nyheter/nordea-vi-godtar-inte-skatteflykt |trans-title=Nordea: we do not accept tax evasion |language=Swedish |title=Nordea: Vi godtar inte skatteflykt |last=von Koskul |first=Casper |date=April 4, 2016 |publisher=SVT Nyheter |access-date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024658/http://www.svt.se/nyheter/nordea-vi-godtar-inte-skatteflykt |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
In response to the leaks, Prime Minister [[Stefan Löfven]] said he is very critical of Nordea's conduct and role, and Minister of Finance [[Magdalena Andersson (Social Democrat)|Magdalena Andersson]] characterized the bank's conduct as "totally unacceptable".<ref name=local-nordea /><ref name="GpSkams">{{cite news |url=https://www.gp.se/nyheter/sverige/1.3047548-lofven-nordea-pa-skamslistan |title=gp Löfven: Nordea på skämslistan |date=April 4, 2016 |language=Swedish |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160405073335/https://www.gp.se/nyheter/sverige/1.3047548-lofven-nordea-pa-skamslistan |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}<!-- As of 19:42 BST, April 6, 2016, the Swedish language source before this hidden comment was not working, with an HTTP error 521 --><!-- removing the dead link tag, getting a web page just fine today 4/30/2016 --></ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Finansministern om Nordea: "Helt oacceptabelt" |url=http://www.svd.se/finansministern-om-nordea-helt-oacceptabelt |publisher=Svenska Dagbladet |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409035059/http://www.svd.se/finansministern-om-nordea-helt-oacceptabelt |archivedate=April 9, 2016 |language=Swedish |date=April 4, 2016}}</ref>
==== Switzerland ==== On April 6, the federal police searched [[UEFA]] headquarters in [[Nyon]] as part of a "criminal mismanagement" probe into a [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] television rights deal signed by [[FIFA]]'s new president [[Gianni Infantino]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/swiss-police-raid-uefa-as-panama-papers-scandal-spreads/42064464 |title=Swiss police raid UEFA as Panama Papers scandal spreads |language=English |publisher=''Swissinfo'' |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409043149/http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/swiss-police-raid-uefa-as-panama-papers-scandal-spreads/42064464 |archivedate=April 9, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The same day, Geneva's attorney general opened several procedures in reaction to a report about misconduct by Swiss lawyers and trustees.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rts.ch/info/regions/geneve/7630703-suite-aux-panama-papers-la-justice-genevoise-a-ouvert-des-procedures.html |title=Suite aux "Panama Papers", la justice genevoise a ouvert des procédures |language=French |publisher=''RTS'' |date=7 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423232630/http://www.rts.ch/info/regions/geneve/7630703-suite-aux-panama-papers-la-justice-genevoise-a-ouvert-des-procedures.html |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On April 8, a few hours after the publication of a new series of articles focusing on art hidden behind offshore companies, a prosecutor sequestered a [[Amedeo Modigliani|Modigliani]] worth some $25 million at [[Geneva Freeport]].<ref name=ICIJart>{{cite news |url=https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160407-art-secrecy-offshore.html |title=The Art of Secrecy: Locked in the files of a Panama law firm are the answers to mysteries involving Van Goghs, Picassos, Rembrandts and other masterworks |author=Jake Bernstein |date=7 April 2016 |accessdate=21 April 2016 |publisher=ICIJ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415215259/https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160407-art-secrecy-offshore.html |archivedate=April 15, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://news.artnet.com/art-world/raid-freeport-geneva-nahmad-modigliani-470591 |title=Prosecutors Raid Geneva Freeport in Search of David Nahmad's Modigliani Painting |language=English |publisher=''Artnet'' |date=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160422121929/https://news.artnet.com/art-world/raid-freeport-geneva-nahmad-modigliani-470591 |archivedate=April 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Litigation in New York alleged the painting had been stolen by Nazis during World War II; the defendants said they did not own it, but the leaked documents show that they control International Art Center, a shell company registered in Panama which does own it.<ref name=ICIJart />
[[Yves Bouvier]] and Russian billionaire [[Dmitry Rybolovlev]], in litigation over art pricing, both have Mossack Fonseca companies.<ref name=ICIJart />
The leaked papers also shed light on the ownership of shell companies in protracted litigation in Lausanne over ownership of artwork from the Gstaad chalet of the late Greek shipping tycoon [[Basil Goulandris]].<ref name=ICIJart /><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-02-18/greek-heiress-sues-after-chalet-s-picassos-monets-vanish |author=Catherine Hickley |title=Greek Heiress Sues After Chalet's Picassos, Monets Vanish |date=17 February 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2016 |publisher=''Bloomberg'' |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160413103505/http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-02-18/greek-heiress-sues-after-chalet-s-picassos-monets-vanish |archivedate=April 13, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On April 11, another investigation into the abuse of the name of charities like Red Cross or WWF was launched.<ref name=BloomRed>{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-panama-tax-charities-idUSKCN0X828W |title=Aid agencies fear damage to reputation as 'Red Cross' appears in Panama Papers |author=Tom Esslemont |date=August 11, 2016 |accessdate=21 April 2016 |publisher=Reuters |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421035847/http://www.reuters.com/article/us-panama-tax-charities-idUSKCN0X828W |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Swiss-based Diacore is a Mossack Fonseca client, and has approximately thirty companies through them. Diacore is run by Daniel Steinmetz, but until recently his brother [[Beny Steinmetz]] had a power of attorney for the company. Diacore is part of the Steinmetz Group.<ref name=NamStein />
==== Ukraine ==== [[File:Official portrait of Petro Poroshenko.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Ukrainian president [[Petro Poroshenko]] ]]
When Ukrainian president [[Petro Poroshenko]] took office in 2014, a popular uprising had just toppled his predecessor, [[Viktor Yanukovych]].<ref name=Velite>{{cite news |url=https://news.vice.com/article/the-panama-papers-massive-leak-reveals-the-global-elites-secret-cash-havens |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529034715/https://news.vice.com/article/the-panama-papers-massive-leak-reveals-the-global-elites-secret-cash-havens |archivedate=2016-05-29 |title=The Panama Papers: Massive Leak Reveals the Global Elite's Secret Cash Havens |author=Tess Owens |date=April 3, 2016 |accessdate=April 24, 2016 |publisher=''Vice''}}</ref> Poroshenko pledged to sell his candy business ([[Roshen]]) if elected, but leaked documents indicate that on August 21, 2014 he instead had Mossack Fonseca set up offshore holding company Prime Asset Partners Ltd in the [[British Virgin Islands]] and moved his company there, roughly two months after the election. The move had the potential to save him millions of dollars on his Ukrainian taxes.<ref name=Poroshenko/> Records in Cyprus show him as the firm's only shareholder.<ref name=Poroshenko2>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/panama-papers-ukraine-petro-poroshenko-secret-offshore-firm-russia |author=Luke Harding |title=Ukraine's leader set up secret offshore firm as battle raged with Russia |work=Guardian |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407003306/http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/panama-papers-ukraine-petro-poroshenko-secret-offshore-firm-russia |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Some legal experts say the explanation may be sound;<ref name=EconUk>{{cite news |title=Nothing to see here |url=https://www.economist.com/news/international/21696506-mossack-fonseca-leak-shakes-ukraine-more-russia-russia-finds-little-say-about-panama |date=April 9, 2016 |accessdate=April 27, 2016 |work=The Economist |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160420103819/http://www.economist.com/news/international/21696506-mossack-fonseca-leak-shakes-ukraine-more-russia-russia-finds-little-say-about-panama |archivedate=April 20, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> however this isn't making a difference to Ukrainian media making the point that Poroshenko opened his offshore account in August 2014 as Ukrainian soldiers were being massacred by the Russians in [[Ilovaisk]].<ref name=EconUk /> The Panama Papers report may also have figured in the defeat of a trade deal with the Netherlands in a referendum there on April 6.<ref name=EconUk />
Anti-corruption group [[Transparency International]] believes that the "creation of businesses while serving as president is a direct violation of the constitution".<ref name="BBC News 2016">{{cite web |title=Panama Papers: Ukraine President Poroshenko denies tax claims |website=BBC News |date=April 4, 2016 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-35958762 |accessdate=April 7, 2016}}</ref> Also, journalists from the [[Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project]] believe that with the move Poroshenko committed two other illegalities, starting a new business while in office and failing afterwards to report it on his disclosure statements.<ref name="BBC News 2016"/> Poroshenko denied any wrongdoing and a spokesman said the offshore company had no active assets and was a legitimate corporate restructure aimed at helping to sell Poroshenko's [[Roshen|Roshen group]].<ref name="BBC News 2016"/> Analysts in Ukraine responded that the secretive way Poroshenko set up these accounts was certain to undermine trust in him, [[Petro Poroshenko Bloc|his party]] and Ukraine itself.<ref name="KyivPost">{{cite web |title=Anything To Hide?: Revelations undercut trust in Poroshenko |date=April 7, 2016 |url=https://www.kyivpost.com/article/content/ukraine-politics/anything-to-hide-revelations-undercut-trust-in-poroshenko-411582.html |publisher=Kyiv Post |author=Oksana Grytsenko |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408212934/http://www.kyivpost.com/article/content/ukraine-politics/anything-to-hide-revelations-undercut-trust-in-poroshenko-411582.html |archivedate=April 8, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The news about Poroshenko's offshore business came as his government campaigned against offshore companies.<ref name=Poroshenko/> [[Oleh Lyashko]], leader of the [[Radical Party of Oleh Lyashko|Radical Party]], urged lawmakers to begin impeachment proceedings,<ref name=Poroshenko/> and even some of his allies backed calls for a parliamentary commission to investigate the allegations.<ref name=Poroshenko/>
In the [[Ukrainian Parliament]], relations between the [[Petro Poroshenko Bloc "Solidarity"|Poroshenko bloc]] and the [[People's Front (Ukraine)|People's Front party]] of Prime Minister [[Arseniy Yatsenyuk]] had over previous months already soured, with mutual accusations of [[corruption in Ukraine|corruption]].<ref name=Poroshenko>{{Cite news |first=Yuras |last=Karmanau |title=Ukrainian president under fire over Panama Papers |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/11aba2aa8d6f474895162f144836728a/ukrainian-president-under-fire-over-panama-papers |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=April 4, 2016 |accessdate=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406024921/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/11aba2aa8d6f474895162f144836728a/ukrainian-president-under-fire-over-panama-papers |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The Prime Minister [[Arseniy Yatsenyuk]] also [https://web.archive.org/web/20160428002417/http://britaintimes.co.uk/panama-leaks-after-shock-ukrainian-is-going-to-resign/ announced he would resign] over Panama Papers leaks.<ref>{{Cite news |first=Arsniy |last=Yatsenyuk |title=Ukrainian PM is going to resign |url=http://britaintimes.co.uk/panama-leaks-after-shock-ukrainian-is-going-to-resign/ |work=Britain Times |date=April 10, 2016 |accessdate=April 10, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160428002417/http://britaintimes.co.uk/panama-leaks-after-shock-ukrainian-is-going-to-resign/ |archivedate=April 28, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== United Kingdom ==== [[File:David Cameron official.jpg|thumb|right|upright|The [[Leader of the Opposition (United Kingdom)|Leader of the Opposition]] has called for an immediate independent investigation into the tax affairs of the family of the then British prime minister [[David Cameron]] (pictured).]] According to ''[[The Guardian]]'', "More than £170bn of UK property is now held overseas. ... Nearly one in 10 of the 31,000 tax haven companies that own British property are linked to Mossack Fonseca."<ref name=real2>{{cite web |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/revealed-how-foreign-buyers-have-bought-100bn-of-london-property-in-six-years-a3095936.html |title=Revealed: How foreign buyers have bought £100bn of London property in six years |first1=Pippa |last1=Crerar |first2=Jonathan |last2=Prynn |date=October 21, 2015 |accessdate=April 6, 2015 |work=Evening Standard |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151024215751/http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/revealed-how-foreign-buyers-have-bought-100bn-of-london-property-in-six-years-a3095936.html |archivedate=October 24, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="auto"/>
Included among the Panama Paper documents are the names of six members of the [[House of Lords]], several of whom have been donors to Cameron's [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]], as well as other Conservative donors.<ref name="another Guardian ref">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/03/the-panama-papers-how-the-worlds-rich-and-famous-hide-their-money-offshore |title=The Panama Papers: how the world's rich and famous hide their money offshore |work=The Guardian |date=April 3, 2016 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6gV2DzrpI?url=http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/03/the-panama-papers-how-the-worlds-rich-and-famous-hide-their-money-offshore |archivedate=April 3, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="Guardian Tory donors">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/tory-donors-links-to-offshore-firms-revealed-in-leaked-panama-papers |title=Tory donors' links to offshore firms revealed in leaked Panama Papers |work=The Guardian |date=April 4, 2016 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406093122/http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/tory-donors-links-to-offshore-firms-revealed-in-leaked-panama-papers |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> These include:
* [[Anthony Bamford]]:<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" /> £4 million in Conservative Party donations, made a Conservative [[life peer]] in 2013; * [[David Rowland]]:<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" /> £3.8 million in Conservative Party donations, former party treasurer; * [[Fleming Family & Partners]]:<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" /> Over £400,000 in Conservative Party donations, including direct donations to David Cameron; * Juniper Equities Trading:<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" /> £250,000 loan to the Conservative Party from an offshore fund with an opaque ownership structure; * [[Tony Buckingham]]:<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" /> £100,000 donation to the Conservative Party; * [[Lord Ashcroft]]:<ref>{{cite news |last1=Boland |first1=Stephanie |title=Lord Ashcroft denies links to Panama Papers firm |url=http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2016/04/lord-ashcroft-denies-links-panama-papers-firm |accessdate=May 17, 2016 |work=New Statesman |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160510024135/http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2016/04/lord-ashcroft-denies-links-panama-papers-firm |archivedate=May 10, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> the man who published "[[piggate]]" allegations about Cameron;<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bennett |first1=Owen |title=Lord Ashcroft's 'Pig-Gate' Book Top Selling Title At Tory Conference #cpc15 |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/10/05/david-cameron-lord-ashcroft-book_n_8243942.html |accessdate=May 17, 2016 |work=The Huffington Post UK |date=October 5, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129113602/http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/10/05/david-cameron-lord-ashcroft-book_n_8243942.html |archivedate=January 29, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * [[Pamela Sharples, Baroness Sharples|Baroness Pamela Sharples]] (via her Bahamas company Nunswell Investments Limited): made a life peer in 1973;<ref>{{cite news |last1=Scott-Delany |first1=Finn |title=Two Tory peers named as part of Panama Papers leak |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/news/14402416.Two_Tory_peers_named_as_part_of_Panama_Papers_leak/ |accessdate=May 17, 2016 |work=The Argus |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160512173205/http://www.theargus.co.uk/news/14402416.Two_Tory_peers_named_as_part_of_Panama_Papers_leak/ |archivedate=May 12, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * Former MP [[Michael Mates]] via his company Haylandale: claimed his company "never had any real value" and registered interests with Parliament.<ref name="Guardian Tory donors" />
As the United Kingdom still exercises varying degrees of control over [[British Overseas Territories]] and [[Crown dependencies]] which make up a large number of the many tax havens and "secrecy jurisdictions" that exist, pressure mounted on Prime Minister David Cameron to make changes.<ref name="WSJMacdonaldGross">{{cite news |last1=MacDonald |first1=Alistair |last2=Gross |first2=Jenny |title='Panama Papers' Raise Pressure on U.K. to Rein in Offshore Tax Havens |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/panama-papers-raise-pressure-on-u-k-to-rein-in-offshore-tax-havens-1459966548 |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |work=Wall Street Journal |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406205929/http://www.wsj.com/articles/panama-papers-raise-pressure-on-u-k-to-rein-in-offshore-tax-havens-1459966548 |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ethicalconsumer.org/commentanalysis/ethicaleconomics/theukandtaxhavens.aspx |title=The UK is the most important player in tax havens |publisher=ethical consumer |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425152609/http://www.ethicalconsumer.org/commentanalysis/ethicaleconomics/theukandtaxhavens.aspx |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'', the Panama Papers "are shining a light on the constellation of offshore centers in the last remnants of the British Empire, from [[Gibraltar]] to the British Virgin Islands (BVI)."<ref name="WSJMacdonaldGross" /> Of the companies created by Mossack Fonseca which were included in the leaked data, the BVI companies topped the list, with 113,000 of the nearly 215,000 companies that Mossack Fonseca managed or incorporated there. British Overseas Territory [[Anguilla]] was 7th on the list.<ref name="Statista chart">{{cite web |url=https://www.statista.com/chart/4587/the-most-popular-tax-havens-in-the-panama-papers/ |title=The Most Popular Tax Havens in the Panama Papers |publisher=The Statistics Portal |date=April 5, 2016 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406071612/https://www.statista.com/chart/4587/the-most-popular-tax-havens-in-the-panama-papers/ |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Cameron criticized complex offshore structures in 2013, saying that it is "not fair and not right what some [companies] are doing by saying 'I've got lots of sales here in the UK but I'm going to pay a sort of royalty fee to another company that I own in another country that has some special tax dispensation.'" He said he would bring up the issue at [[39th G8 summit|the G8 summit that year]].<ref name="Murphy2013">{{cite book |author=Richard Murphy |title=Over Here and Undertaxed: Multinationals, Tax Avoidance and You |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3ualyjX1KQwC&pg=PT31 |date=18 February 2013 |publisher=Random House |isbn=978-1-4481-8038-7 |page=31 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161122083805/https://books.google.com/books?id=3ualyjX1KQwC&pg=PT31 |archivedate=November 22, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> At the summit, Cameron demanded more transparency, arguing that it would be better for business.<ref name="Guardian Tory donors"/> In 2014, Cameron asked all Overseas Territories and Crown dependencies to set up an open register of firms and individuals with investments registered in their jurisdictions, but by the time of the Panama Papers leak in April 2016, only Montserrat and Gibraltar had agreed to do so.<ref name="Soaraway">{{cite news |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/politics/7047718/Top-tax-dodgers-exposed-as-biggest-ever-leak-hits-rich.html |title=Cam panned over Panama: Pressure mounts on PM after father and billionaire backers were named in tax avoidance scandal |work=The Sun |date=April 5, 2016 |accessdate=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407005703/http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/politics/7047718/Top-tax-dodgers-exposed-as-biggest-ever-leak-hits-rich.html |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> [[File:Anti-David Cameron protest 04.jpg|thumb|Protesters outside [[10 Downing Street]] call for David Cameron's resignation, April 9, 2016]]
Leader of the Opposition Jeremy Corbyn said "The government needs to stop pussyfooting around on tax dodging"<ref>{{cite news |last1=Grierson |first1=Jamie |last2=Asthana |first2=Anushka |last3=Mason |first3=Rowena |last4=Walker |first4=Peter |title=David Cameron must come clean on tax, says Jeremy Corbyn |url=http://gu.com/p/4t53g/stw |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |work=The Guardian |date=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160425193633/http://gu.com/p/4t53g/stw |archivedate=April 25, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and called for "direct rule" to be imposed over British Overseas Territories and Crown dependencies that act as tax havens.<ref name="Indie Corbyn"> {{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/panama-papers-jeremy-corbyn-says-david-cameron-should-impose-direct-rule-to-end-uk-tax-havens-a6969361.html |title=Panama Papers: Jeremy Corbyn says |archivedate=April 6, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Former Business Secretary [[Vince Cable]] agreed, although former attorney general [[Dominic Grieve]] described the proposal as a "bit of a nuclear inhabitants in the finance industry.<ref>{{cite news |author1=Editorial |title=Judge The PM on His Deeds |url=https://www.morningstaronline.co.uk/a-34e6-Judge-the-PM-on-his-deeds |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |work=Morning Star |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407224707/https://www.morningstaronline.co.uk/a-34e6-Judge-the-PM-on-his-deeds |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The Labour Party also said that Cameron's planned "anti-corruption" summit in May<ref>{{cite news |title=UK to hold 'anti corruption summit' in 2016 |url=http://www.ft.com/fastft/2015/07/28/uk-hold-anti-corruption-summit-2016/?ft_site=falcon&desktop=true |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |work=Financial Times |date=July 28, 2015}}</ref> would be "a charade" if Cameron, as chairman of the summit, did not require representatives of all Crown dependencies and overseas territories to attend.<ref name="MSAbbott">{{cite news |last1=Sabin 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Jennie Granger, a spokeswoman for HMRC, said that the department had received "a great deal of information on offshore companies, including in Panama, from a wide range of sources, which is currently the subject of intensive investigation". She said HMRC had asked ICIJ to share all its data.<ref name="BBC: reveal" /><ref name=ITVApr416>{{cite news |url=http://www.itv.com/news/update/2016-04-04/hmrc-ready-to-follow-up-panama-papers-allegations/ |title=HMRC ready to follow up Panama papers allegations |date=April 4, 2016 |work=[[ITV News]] |accessdate=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405103243/http://www.itv.com/news/update/2016-04-04/hmrc-ready-to-follow-up-panama-papers-allegations/ |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
''Private Eye'' revealed that [[Edward Troup]], appointed executive chair of HMRC in April 2016, was a former partner with [[Simmons & Simmons]], the London-based legal firm whose clients included the Panama-registered fund created by David Cameron's father, Blairmore Holdings.<ref name="P Eye Troup">{{cite news |url=http://www.private-eye.co.uk/issue-1413/news |title=New Troup movements at HMRC |work=Private Eye |issue=1413 |accessdate=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160321151453/http://www.private-eye.co.uk/issue-1413/news |archivedate=March 21, 2016}}</ref><ref name="Guardian Troup">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/apr/10/hmrc-chief-partner-law-firm-offshore-fund-cameron |title=HMRC chief was partner at law firm that acted for Cameron offshore fund |work=The Guardian |date=April 11, 2016 |accessdate=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160411043131/http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/apr/10/hmrc-chief-partner-law-firm-offshore-fund-cameron |archivedate=April 11, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Papers obtained by the ''Süddeutsche Zeitung'' and ICIJ reveal Simmons & Simmons' close relationship with running offshore companies and major overseas property owners, including an investment company run on behalf of Sheikh [[Hamad bin Abdullah Al Thani]], while Troup was its senior tax partner.<ref>{{cite news |title=Troup Manoeuvres |work=Private Eye |issue=1416 |date=15 April 2016 |page=8}}</ref>
===== Blairmore Holdings, Inc. ===== {{Main|Blairmore Holdings}} [[Ian Cameron (stockbroker)|Ian Cameron]], the late father of UK Prime Minister [[David Cameron]], ran an offshore fund ([[Blairmore Holdings]], Inc.) through Mossack Fonseca that avoided UK taxes for 30 years. His company moved to Ireland after David Cameron became Prime Minister.<ref name="Tel Ireland">{{cite news |last1=Rayner |first1=Gordon |last2=Morgan |first2=Tom |last3=Riley-Smith |first3=Ben |title=Panama Papers: offshore firm set up by Cameron's father was moved to Ireland in year son became PM |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/04/05/panama-papers-david-cameron-forced-to-declare-tax-affairs-amid-o/ |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405200445/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/04/05/panama-papers-david-cameron-forced-to-declare-tax-affairs-amid-o/ |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On April 6, Cameron admitted that he had owned shares in Blairmore, but said he sold his shares before becoming PM.<ref name="GuardAdmit">{{cite news |last1=Booth |first1=Robert |last2=Watt |first2=Holly |last3=Pegg |first3=David |title=David Cameron admits he profited from father's Panama offshore trust fund |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/07/david-cameron-admits-he-profited-fathers-offshore-fund-panama-papers |work=The Guardian |date=April 7, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161201230330/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/07/david-cameron-admits-he-profited-fathers-offshore-fund-panama-papers |archivedate=December 1, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Prominent politicians criticized the involvement of the Cameron family in the scandal; [[Leader of the Opposition (UK)|Leader of the Opposition]] [[Jeremy Corbyn]] urged an immediate independent investigation into the tax affairs of Cameron's family as well as tighter laws on [[tax avoidance in the United Kingdom|UK tax avoidance]].<ref name=TaxAvoid>

=== Asia ===
==== Armenia ==== The Panama Papers show Major-General of Justice and head of Armenia's Compulsory Enforcement Service [[Mihran Poghosyan]] was connected to three Panama-registered companies: Sigtem Real Estates Inc., Hopkinten Trading Inc., and Bangio Invest S.A., which issued [[bearer shares]] only. Poghosyan, who has a degree in economics, was the sole owner of Sigtem and Hopkinten,<ref name="hetq">{{cite web |url=http://hetq.am/eng/news/66918/mihran-poghosyan-the-armenian-general-who-mastered-the-ins-and-outs-of-panamas-offshore-zone.html |title=Mihran Poghosyan: The Armenian General Who Mastered the Ins and Outs of Panama's Offshore Zone |work=[[Hetq Online]] |date=April 4, 2016 |accessdate=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408115216/http://hetq.am/eng/news/66918/mihran-poghosyan-the-armenian-general-who-mastered-the-ins-and-outs-of-panamas-offshore-zone.html/ |archivedate=April 8, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.occrp.org/en/panamapapers/armenian-master-of-offshores/ |title=The General: An Armenian Master of Offshores |publisher=[[OCCRP]] |date=April 8, 2016 |accessdate=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415222706/https://www.occrp.org/en/panamapapers/armenian-master-of-offshores/ |archivedate=April 15, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> which together owned Best Realty Ltd, recently awarded government contracts.<ref name="hetq" />
Poghosian resigned April 18, saying that it was unacceptable that he had caused Armenia's name to be mentioned alongside that of Azerbaijan, whose president [[Ilham Aliyev]] "actually embezzled billions of dollars."<ref name=compulsory>{{cite web |url=http://www.harkadir.am/view-lang-eng-article-359.html |title=Compulsory Enforcement Service |publisher=Ministry of Justice of RA |accessdate=2016-05-15 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423005218/http://www.harkadir.am/view-lang-eng-article-359.html |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On April 8, Armenian Transparency International Anti-Corruption Center filed a petition with the Ethics Committee for High Level Officials, requesting an investigation of Poghosyan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hetq.am/eng/news/67171/panama-papers-fallout-in-armenia-local-ngo-files-petition-to-launch-investigation-of-top-official.html |title=Panama Papers Fallout in Armenia; Local NGO Files Petition to Launch Investigation of Top Official |work=[[Hetq Online]] |date=April 8, 2016 |accessdate=April 11, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160413072157/http://hetq.am/eng/news/67171/panama-papers-fallout-in-armenia-local-ngo-files-petition-to-launch-investigation-of-top-official.html |archivedate=April 13, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Members of the families of Poghosyan's uncles Grigor and Mikhail Haroutyunyan were also mentioned in connection with his business.<ref name="hetq"/>
Varuzhan Hotkanian, head of the Armenian branch of the anti-corruption watchdog Transparency International, said that perhaps Poghosian was forced to resign by the country's leadership, since the evidence pointed directly to him. But, he said, he still questions the government's commitment to fighting corruption.<ref name=TI>{{cite web |url=http://transparency.am/en/news/view/1401 |title=Why Armenian Official Resigns Over Panama Leaks |author=Transparency International |date=April 18, 2016 |accessdate=April 26, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160513015606/http://transparency.am/en/news/view/1401 |archivedate=May 13, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Leading opposition figure [[Levon Zourabian]] demanded answers on the matter from the floor of Parliament.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.azatutyun.am/content/article/27681632.html |title=Armenian Official Resigns Over Panama Leaks |date=April 18, 2016 |accessdate=April 26, 2016 |author=Karine Simonian |publisher=azatutyun.am |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160514002753/http://www.azatutyun.am/content/article/27681632.html |archivedate=May 14, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== Azerbaijan ==== [[File:Ilham Aliyev par Claude Truong-Ngoc juin 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|President of Azerbaijan [[Ilham Aliyev]] ]] [[Azerbaijan International Mineral Resources Operating Company]] Ltd (AIMROC) and its consortium partners spent nearly US$230 million to open a mine and build a refinery in the western Azerbaijani village of [[Chovdar, Dashkasan|Chovdar]]. AIMROC possibly produced US$30 million in gold before suddenly disappearing without making payroll in May 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.meydan.tv/en/site/news/11417/Chovdar-Gold-Mine-Workers-Demand-Their-Salaries.htm |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529034628/https://www.meydan.tv/en/site/news/11417/Chovdar-Gold-Mine-Workers-Demand-Their-Salaries.htm |archivedate=2016-05-29 |title=Chovdar Gold Mine Workers Demand Their Salaries |date=January 26, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |author=MeydanTV}}</ref> Mine employees officially remain on vacation and under Azerbaijani law full-time employees cannot seek work elsewhere even though they have not been paid for two years.<ref name=OCAzPP>{{cite news |url=https://www.occrp.org/en/panamapapers/aliyev-mining-empire/ |title=Aliyevs' Secret Mining Empire |author1=Miranda Patrucic |author2=Eleanor Rose |author3=Lejla Camdzic |author4=Khadija Ismayilova |publisher=OCCRP |date=April 3, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160601094225/https://www.occrp.org/en/panamapapers/aliyev-mining-empire/ |archivedate=June 1, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
A 2012 investigation, by [[Radio Free Europe]] and the [[Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project]] (OCCRP) discovered that through overseas holding companies, the daughters of Azerbaijani president [[Ilham Aliyev]] owned an interest in a gold mine operation created by a 2006 presidential decree forming a consortium, then awarding it a 30-year lease over environmental and transparency objections in Parliament.<ref name=inv2012>{{cite news |url=https://www.occrp.org/en/investigations/1495-azerbaijans-president-awarded-family-stake-in-gold-fields |title=Azerbaijan's President Awarded Family Stake in Gold Fields |date=May 3, 2012 |author1=By Khadija Ismayilova |author2=Nushaba Fatullayeva |publisher=OCCRP |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160601224142/https://www.occrp.org/en/investigations/1495-azerbaijans-president-awarded-family-stake-in-gold-fields |archivedate=June 1, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
But the Panama Papers made it possible to trace some of the elaborate network of shell companies that manage the ownership of the mines, and in 2016 OCCRP was able to establish that in fact the daughters control the mining operation.<ref name=OCAzPP />
Aliyev awarded the gold mines to Globex International LLP, Londex Resources S.A., Willy & Meyris S.A. and Fargate Mining Corporation. Thirty percent of the proceeds were allocated to the government of Azerbaijan; 11% of the remaining 70% went to Globex, 45% to Londex, 29% to Willy & Meyris and the remaining 15% to Fargate.<ref name=inv2012 />
These companies were registered in Panama, according to the documents obtained from Panama Registry of Companies.<ref>{{cite web |title=Radio RF/RFL, last updated in April 2016 |url=http://www.rferl.org/a/azerbaijan_gold-field_contract_awarded_to_presidents_family/24569192.html |publisher=RFRL |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161218194532/http://www.rferl.org/a/azerbaijan_gold-field_contract_awarded_to_presidents_family/24569192.html |archivedate=December 18, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> A one of them, Fargate Mining Corporation was founded by Tagiva Management Ltd., Tagiva Services Ltd. and Verda Management Ltd. They issued the General Power of Attorney granted in favour of Azerbaijan-born individual Mr. Nasib Hasanov.<ref>{{cite web |title=OCCRP.ORG, last updated in May 2016 |url=https://cdn.occrp.org/projects/panamapapers/aliyevmines/2005-12-15_Fargate%20Mining%20Corp_General%20Power%20of%20Attorney.pdf |publisher=OCCPR.ORG |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220214757/https://cdn.occrp.org/projects/panamapapers/aliyevmines/2005-12-15_Fargate%20Mining%20Corp_General%20Power%20of%20Attorney.pdf |archivedate=December 20, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Later, Londex Resources S.A., Globex International LLP, Fargate Mining Corporation and Willy&Meyris S.A. had been registered again at St. Kitts and Nevis with same addresses.<ref>{{cite web |title="ICIJ", last update in June 2016 |url=http://icijold.com/?submit=Search&info=Redgold+Estates+Ltd |publisher=ICIJOLD.COM}}</ref> It already used for registering other offshore energy holding – The Nobel Oil Ltd., partner of the state oil company SOCAR in Azerbaijan over [[Umid gas field]]. Founder of [[Nobel Oil Group]] also is Mr. N. Hasanov.
The 2012 investigation's reporters, established that Globex was owned through shell companies in Panama, and that these shell companies belonged to the president's daughters and a Swiss businessman whose name appears in other shell companies such as those that manage Azerphone, the family telecommunications monopoly. Villagers told reporters they hoped to work at the mine, which paid $12 a day, and asked them to intervene with the president about the problems the mine was causing with the water supply. They became angry and did not believe the reporters when they said the president's family had a stake in the mine.<ref name=inv2012 />
Following the May publication of this report, the National Assembly passed a law making it illegal to report company ownership<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.radioazadlyg.org/content/article/24612973.html |title=Придет ли Азербайджан к открытости? |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120618114118/http://www.radioazadlyg.org/content/article/24612973.html |archivedate=June 18, 2012 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and another giving former presidents and first ladies lifelong legal immunity.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://rus.azattyq.org/a/ilham-aliyev-mehriban-aliyeva-azerbaijan-immunity/24612838.html |title=Ильхам Алиев тоже получил пожизненный иммунитет |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160616230020/http://rus.azattyq.org/a/ilham-aliyev-mehriban-aliyeva-azerbaijan-immunity/24612838.html |archivedate=June 16, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Khadija Ismayilova, the Radio Free Europe reporter on the 2012 investigation was subjected to escalating legal and public harassment. She was threatened and eventually arrested. She is currently serving a 7.5 year sentence for tax evasion and abuse of power.<ref>{{cite news |title=In Azerbaijan, 'a declaration of war against independent journalism' |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/a-declaration-of-war-against-independent-journalism/2016/04/25/d2bbbdb8-0b12-11e6-8ab8-9ad050f76d7d_story.html |publisher=Washington Post |author=Editorial Board |date=April 25, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160427150240/https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/a-declaration-of-war-against-independent-journalism/2016/04/25/d2bbbdb8-0b12-11e6-8ab8-9ad050f76d7d_story.html |archivedate=April 27, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Leaked Mossack Fonseca documents made it possible to establish that the daughters also owned Londex, the majority partner in the gold enterprise. It is not entirely clear why they shut the operation down but industry experts familiar with the consortium say it did not seem very experienced and may have rushed into production.<ref name=OCAzPP />
According to the ICIJ, Aliyev's daughter Arzu not only has financial stakes not only in gold rights but also in Azerfon, the country's largest mobile phone business. She has shares in SW Holding, which "controls nearly every operation related to Azerbaijan Airlines" (Azal), from meals to airport taxis. Both sisters and their brother Heydar own property in Dubai valued at roughly $75 million in 2010; Heydar is the legal owner of nine luxury mansions in Dubai purchased for some $44 million.<ref name="icij"/>
Leaked documents show that daughters Leyla and Arzu Aliyeva both hold shares in Exaltation Limited, incorporated in April 2015 for "holding UK property". Child & Child, a London law firm that registered it and obtained nominee directors for it though the [[Jersey]] branch of Mossack, claimed in doing so that the women had no political connections.<ref name=Azer>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/05/panama-papers-london-law-firm-helped-azerbaijan-first-family-set-up-secret-offshore-firm |title=London law firm helped Azerbaijan's first family set up secret offshore firm: Panama Papers shine light on hidden property portfolio of President Aliyev's daughters |author1=Juliette Garside |author2=Luke Harding |author3=David |author4=Holly Watt |work=The Guardian |date=5 April 2016 |accessdate=19 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160419025140/http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/05/panama-papers-london-law-firm-helped-azerbaijan-first-family-set-up-secret-offshore-firm |archivedate=April 19, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="icij">{{cite web |url=https://www.icij.org/offshore/offshore-companies-provide-link-between-corporate-mogul-and-azerbaijans-president |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529034554/https://www.icij.org/offshore/offshore-companies-provide-link-between-corporate-mogul-and-azerbaijans-president |archivedate=2016-05-29 |title=Offshore companies provide link between corporate mogul and Azerbaijan's president |publisher=ICIJ |date=April 3, 2016 |accessdate=April 11, 2016}}</ref>
The family of Azerbaijan President Ilham Aliyev leads a well-off life thanks in part to financial interests in various sectors of the nation's economy. His wife ascendants are privileged and powerful family that owns banks, insurance and construction companies, a television station and a line of cosmetics. She is well known for her pre-eminent charity work that has led to the construction of schools, hospitals and the country's major sports complex.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://projects.icij.org/panama-papers/power-players/?lang=en#50|title=Panama Papers {{!}} The Power Players|website=projects.icij.org|access-date=2017-08-04|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170803231238/https://projects.icij.org/panama-papers/power-players/?lang=en#50|archivedate=August 3, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
==== Bangladesh ==== On April 7, 2016, the [[Anti Corruption Commission Bangladesh]] launched an inquiry to obtain details of the businesses and individuals allegedly affiliated with Mossack Fonseca.<ref>{{cite news |title=ACC launches probes against those named in Panama Papers |url=http://www.observerbd.com/2016/04/08/145731.php |accessdate=22 April 2016 |publisher=The Daily Observer |date=8 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160411114840/http://www.observerbd.com/2016/04/08/145731.php |archivedate=April 11, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Allegations have been made against thirty-two Bangladeshi individuals and two corporations, however, media outlets staking this claim have referenced an old ICIJ database of information compiled during the investigation of the 2013 Offshore Leaks.<ref>{{cite web |author1=JagoNews24 |title=পানামা পেপারস ফাঁসের নথিতে ৩২ বাংলাদেশি |url=http://www.jagonews24.com/national/news/91468/%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%AE%E0%A6%BE-%E0%A6%AA%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%B0%E0%A6%B8-%E0%A6%AB%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%81%E0%A6%B8%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B0-%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%A5%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%87-%E0%A7%A9%E0%A7%A8-%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%B2%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B6%E0%A6%BF |accessdate=26 April 2016 |publisher=JagoNews24 |language=Bengali |date=6 April 2016 |quote="Papers leaked document Bangladeshi Panama 3" |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160511151935/http://www.jagonews24.com/national/news/91468/%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%AE%E0%A6%BE-%E0%A6%AA%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%AA%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%B0%E0%A6%B8-%E0%A6%AB%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%81%E0%A6%B8%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B0-%E0%A6%A8%E0%A6%A5%E0%A6%BF%E0%A6%A4%E0%A7%87-%E0%A7%A9%E0%A7%A8-%E0%A6%AC%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%82%E0%A6%B2%E0%A6%BE%E0%A6%A6%E0%A7%87%E0%A6%B6%E0%A6%BF |archivedate=May 11, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==== China ==== [[File:Xi Jinping October 2015.jpg|upright|thumb|Chinese [[paramount leader]] [[Xi Jinping]] ]]
Relatives of highly placed Chinese officials including seven current and former senior leaders of the [[Politburo of the Communist Party of China]] have been named, including former Premier [[Li Peng]]'s daughter [[Li Xiaolin]], former [[Communist Party of China|Communist Party]] general secretary [[Hu Yaobang]]'s son [[Hu Dehua]] and [[Deng Jiagui]], the brother-in-law of current [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of China|general secretary]] [[Xi Jinping]]. Deng had two shell companies in the British Virgin Islands while Xi was a member of the [[Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China|Politburo Standing Committee]], but they were dormant by the time Xi became [[General Secretary]] of the Communist Party ([[paramount leader]]) in November 2012. Others named include the son and daughter-in-law of propaganda chief [[Liu Yunshan]] and the son-in-law of Vice-Premier [[Zhang Gaoli]].<ref name=MP>{{cite news |url=http://www.marketplace.org/2016/04/04/world/xi-jinpings-family-linked-panama-papers |title=Xi Jinping's family linked to Panama Papers |accessdate=April 6, 2016 |publisher=Marketplace |first=Rob |last=Schmitz |date=April 4, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407224017/http://www.marketplace.org/2016/04/04/world/xi-jinpings-family-linked-panama-papers |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Official Chinese statistics show investment in [[British Overseas Territories]] acting as tax havens being much more significant than in other places: $44 billion invested in the [[Cayman Islands]] and $49 billion in the [[British Virgin Islands]]. Despite these figures "probably exclud[ing] the private investments of the many family members of the ruling elite who have channelled money through the BVI", both figures exceed Chinese investment in the [[United States]] and [[United Kingdom]].<ref name=Eye1416p37>{{cite news |title=In the Back: Great haul of China |work=Private Eye |issue=1416 |date=April 15, 2016 |page=37 |url=http://www.private-eye.co.uk/issue-1416/in-the-back |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423195648/http://www.private-eye.co.uk/issue-1416/in-the-back |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |via=the [[Wayback Machine]]}}</ref>
China's government [[Internet censorship in China|is suppressing]] mention of the Panama Papers on social media and in search engines results,<ref>{{cite news |title=Panama papers: China censors online discussion |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-35957235 |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |agency=[[BBC News]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405002948/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-35957235 |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> and reportedly told news organizations to delete all content related to the Panama Papers leak. Chinese authorities consider the material a concerted foreign media attack on China, and ordered Internet information offices to delete reports reprinted from the Panama Papers, and with no exceptions not to follow up on related content. [[Hong Lei (diplomat)|Hong Lei]], spokesman for China's foreign ministry, responded that he had "no comment" for "such groundless accusations" at an April 5 news conference.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kaiman |first1=Jonathan |title=China censors media coverage about the 'Panama Papers' |url=http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-china-panama-papers-censorship-20160405-story.html |accessdate=April 5, 2016 |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=April 5, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405173521/http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-china-panama-papers-censorship-20160405-story.html |archivedate=April 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
A screenshot showed<!-- shown in cited article --> that authorities had forced all websites to delete content about the Panama Papers.<ref>{{cite news |title=【真理部】自查自删涉"巴拿马文件"泄露事件所有相关内容 |url=http://chinadigitaltimes.net/chinese/2016/04/%E3%80%90%E7%9C%9F%E7%90%86%E9%83%A8%E3%80%91%E8%87%AA%E6%9F%A5%E8%87%AA%E5%88%A0%E6%B6%89%E5%B7%B4%E6%8B%BF%E9%A9%AC%E6%96%87%E4%BB%B6%E6%B3%84%E9%9C%B2%E4%BA%8B%E4%BB%B6%E6%89%80/ |trans-title="Ministry of Truth" changed the truth by deleting all "Panama file" related content |publisher=China Digital Times |accessdate=April 8, 2016 |language=Chinese |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408101411/http://chinadigitaltimes.net/chinese/2016/04/%e3%80%90%e7%9c%9f%e7%90%86%e9%83%a8%e3%80%91%e8%87%aa%e6%9f%a5%e8%87%aa%e5%88%a0%e6%b6%89%e5%b7%b4%e6%8b%bf%e9%a9%ac%e6%96%87%e4%bb%b6%e6%b3%84%e9%9c%b2%e4%ba%8b%e4%bb%b6%e6%89%80/ |archivedate=April 8, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Foreign websites such as [[WikiLeaks]] and [[China Digital Times]] are [[The Great Firewall|blocked from mainland China]]. On [[Sina Weibo]], a Twitter-like social media website, censors deleted content about the Panama Paper. However, the name of Xi's brother-in-law got through, and Weibo users tried to circumvent them with less obvious language such as "brother-in-law", "Canal Papers" (for the [[Panama Canal]]), and so on.<ref>{{cite web |title=【敏感词库】"Panama"、冰岛总理辞职等热点 2016-4-05 |url=http://chinadigitaltimes.net/chinese/2016/04/%E3%80%90%E6%95%8F%E6%84%9F%E8%AF%8D%E5%BA%93%E3%80%91panama%EF%BC%8C%E5%86%B0%E5%B2%9B%E6%80%BB%E7%90%86%E8%BE%9E%E8%81%8C%E7%AD%89%E7%83%AD%E7%82%B92016-4-05/ |website=China Digital Times |publisher=China Digital Times |accessdate=April 8, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408101153/http://chinadigitaltimes.net/chinese/2016/04/%E3%80%90%E6%95%8F%E6%84%9F%E8%AF%8D%E5%BA%93%E3%80%91panama%EF%BC%8C%E5%86%B0%E5%B2%9B%E6%80%BB%E7%90%86%E8%BE%9E%E8%81%8C%E7%AD%89%E7%83%AD%E7%82%B92016-4-05/ |archivedate=April 8, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Despite the censorship, Weibo search ranking was topped by phrases seemingly related to the Panama Papers, such as "tax evasion", "document", "leak" and "Putin".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Caide |first1=Fu |last2=Shuangzhou |first2=Wang |title=权贵家族上榜，中国封锁"巴拿马文件"相关报道 |trans-title=China blocked "Panama files"; family of dignitaries listed |language=Chinese |url=http://cn.nytimes.com/china/20160406/c06chinapanama/ |accessdate=April 8, 2016 |agency=The New York Times |issue=The New York Times |date=April 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407180551/http://cn.nytimes.com/china/20160406/c06chinapanama/ |archivedate=April 7, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Chinese entertainment magnate and art collector Wang Zhongjun also appears in the documents and did not respond to a request for comment.<ref name=ICIJart />
According to the [[Tax Justice Network]], Chinese investors sometimes use overseas companies to take advantage of incentives China offers to foreign investors.<ref name=NARthird/>
Canadian broadcaster [[Radio Canada]] has reported that Hong Kong-based [[CITIC]] Pacific had Mossack Fonseca set up or manage more than 90 subsidiaries, and that the Chinese government was a majority stakeholder, according to fiscal expert Marwah Rizqy, professor of tax law at the [[Université de Sherbrooke]].<ref name=CBCChina>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/power-corporation-panama-papers-chinese-1.3544919 |title=Quebec's Power Corporation had shares in Chinese company cited in Panama Papers: André Desmarais was member of Chinese company's board of directors for 16 years |author1=Salimah Shivji |author2=Gino Harel |date=20 April 2016 |accessdate=22 April 2016 |publisher=CBC News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160421232744/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/power-corporation-panama-papers-chinese-1.3544919 |archivedate=April 21, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===== Hong Kong ===== Mossack Fonseca's Hong Kong office was its busiest, says the ICIJ, as Chinese officials and other wealthy figures would carry funds across the border and deposit them there to be channeled to offshore entities.<ref name=NARthird/> Hong Kong invested HK$4.6 trillion (£360 billion) into the BVI – more than Hong Kong invested in [[mainland China]] – and received HK$4.1 trillion (over £300 billion) from the BVI. A further £20 billion or so was placed into the Cayman Islands and Bermuda individually.<ref name=Eye1416p37 />
Newspaper ''[[Ming Pao]]'' fired deputy editor Keung Kwok-yuen following a front-page article on the Panama Papers which mentioned many prominent Hong Kong citizens. The paper blamed a "difficult business environment," but had previously fired another editor in 2014 over another leak of offshore documents.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160421-us-investigation-hongkong-editor.html |title=US Prosecutor Opens Investigation Into 'Panama Papers Matters' |author=Martha M. Hamilton |date=21 April 2016 |accessdate=21 April 2016 |publisher=ICIJ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160505202121/https://panamapapers.icij.org/20160421-us-investigation-hongkong-editor.html |archivedate=May 5, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Employees have been publishing blank columns scattered through the newspaper in protest of his dismissal.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.hongkongfp.com/2016/04/27/blank-columns-protesting-top-editors-sudden-firing-appear-in-ming-pao-for-4th-consecutive-day/ |work=Hong Kong Free Press |title=Blank columns protesting top editor's sudden firing appear in Ming Pao for 4th consecutive day |date=April 27, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016 |author=Kris Cheng |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160428104058/https://www.hongkongfp.com/2016/04/27/blank-columns-protesting-top-editors-sudden-firing-appear-in-ming-pao-for-4th-consecutive-day/ |archivedate=April 28, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-china-blog-36136661 |title=Hong Kong journalists protest at editor's sacking with blank columns |author=Juliana Liu |date=April 28, 2016 |accessdate=30 April 2016 |publisher=BBC News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160430042654/http://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-china-blog-36136661 |archivedate=April 30, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
[[Hong Kong Polytechnic University|Polytechnic University]] has two offshore companies set up by Mossack Fonseca in 2012 and 2013. One was created by vice-president [[Nicholas Yang]] Wei-hsiung, who became IT minister of Hong Kong.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/1937819/hong-kong-innovation-minister-polytechnic-university |title=Hong Kong innovation minister, Polytechnic University embroiled in Panama Papers leaks: Documents show that Nicholas Yang was involved with two companies set up by the institution through Panamanian law firm Mossack-Fonseca in the British Virgin Islands |date=22 April 2016 |accessdate=22 April 2016 |publisher=South China Morning Post |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423192653/http://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/1937819/hong-kong-innovation-minister-polytechnic-university |archivedate=April 23, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
